title: RIOT, is Shaco's thunderlord issue a BUG or NOT?
body:
RIOT Hasn't answered ANY post regarding this issue. (or Shaco's rework in general)

Thunderlord's DOESN'T proc if you backstab (his new passive) someone as Shaco.

1 patch later, still no answer, still nothing in the new patch notes.

Working as intended? Or a lack of fucks given?

replies.body: That's a bug. We've got a fix in for testing for patch 6.24, along with a change to address another issue with the passive (Backstab always dealing its own damage if the attack also naturally crits - it should take whichever of the values is higher).
so if it goes smoothly, crit Shaco won't lose damage if he gets backstabs? Will he gain any damage, or will it just be damage he was already doing?

6.23 Shaco: Backstab deals 120% to 145% damage (scales with level), regardless of whether the attack rolls a crit or not.
6.24 Shaco: Non crit backstabs deal 120% to 145% damage. Crit backstabs deal 200% damage (250% with IE).

so it'll just be more of letting AD shaco get the early crits, then scale normally once he has Shiv and IE?

will that affect his Q's bonus damage too?
It means that an attack that crits won't have its damage lowered if that attack was also a Backstab proc.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sTYErWaV,comment-id=00000000000000010000,timestamp=2016-11-23T23:04:43.612+0000)
>
> It means that an attack that crits won't have its damage lowered if that attack was also a Backstab proc.

Nor will it be increased by backstab, so effectively wasting it? I didn't follow this much since I don't play Shaco, so was this the accepted scenario from the start? Cause it seems pretty weird to me.

> [{quoted}](name=YouCanMilkThose,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sTYErWaV,comment-id=000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2016-11-24T07:12:51.763+0000)
>
> Nor will it be increased by backstab, so effectively wasting it? I didn't follow this much since I don't play Shaco, so was this the accepted scenario from the start? Cause it seems pretty weird to me.

When you make a 100% useless post.

lawl

Meddler said the same thing 3 times. Must it go to 4?
I'm going to cry, ty finally !

> [{quoted}](name=z12x34cv,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sTYErWaV,comment-id=0000000000000006,timestamp=2016-11-28T19:09:45.827+0000)
>
> Crit backstabs deal 200% damage (250% with IE).
> Normal crit deals 200% damage (250% with IE) TOO.
> 
> So crit backstabs deal as much as a crit without backstab, then what's the point for an AD crit shaco to make a backstab when he doesn't even get rewarded for making a backstab{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

Where did you see that?

AFAIK it's like this: 6.23 Shaco: Backstab deals 120% to 145% damage (scales with level), regardless of whether the attack rolls a crit or not.

6.24 Shaco: Non crit backstabs deal 120% to 145% damage. Crit backstabs deal 200% damage (250% with IE).

Where did i see what?

The thing you just said is exactly same as what i said ---There are no difference between backstab+crit and Normal crit

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sTYErWaV,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-11-23T21:23:26.151+0000)
>
> 6.23 Shaco: Backstab deals 120% to 145% damage (scales with level), regardless of whether the attack rolls a crit or not.
> 6.24 Shaco: Non crit backstabs deal 120% to 145% damage. Crit backstabs deal 200% damage (250% with IE).

-
> [{quoted}](name=Bardful,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sTYErWaV,comment-id=0000000000000004,timestamp=2016-11-28T04:23:32.330+0000)
>
> Shouldn't crit shaco be rewarded at least a little for backstabbing. Maybe if the backstab was a crit it deals 200% damage and some new interesting effect (like bleed damage or flat damage or extra cdr on q or more interestingly gain an ap ratio or something so really weird hybrid crit builds could be a useful approach too).

Maybe each natural crit combined with passive backstab should lower Shaco's Ult Cooldown by 5 seconds or something (more or less). This would only work against Champions.

If you've high CDR, 40 to 45%, I think you get about 1.65 to 1.8 seconds CD per backstab. At 4.8 to 5.4 seconds if you backstab as soon as you are able to 3 times, you'd have lowered the CD on the ult by 15 seconds. Crit builds could use some love on Shaco.

The lore excuse could be something like, "With his enemies' back turned, Shaco locates and attacks their **MOST** vital areas (found with the additional help of the crit items, rather than standard vital areas he finds with the passive alone), feeding his treacherous lusts, thereby enhancing his senses in that instant, and enabling his most deceitful ability to be used with greater frequency."

Only thing about that is it makes you build crit. If they want to give Shaco many options for builds it's nice since it's not too strong, but gives you a benefit for going crit. You could go AP with no crit and get the benefits that gives to your damage, and box lifetime (how long it can go unused before dying). You could go damage + tank with no crit and have more presence in teamfights without blowing up. Or, you can take the somewhat risky route of being a squishy crit assassin who's able to Ult more frequently if he gets backstabs off on Champions a few times in a short period.

I don't think it would be too strong since you'd be combining the passive and normal crits, without both happening at the same time it wouldn't proc the ult CD being lowered. Also the CD reduction would only proc against Champions.

With 70-100% crit this would be a fairly potent addition to his arsenal, but restricted to those who build crit, which is already considered a mostly weak avenue for Shaco at higher ELOs from what I've heard.

Would be nice to get feedback from one of the Red Riot staff members on this.
Love Shaco btw, eagerly awaiting next patch when the crit damage is fixed on his passive. :)

P.S. - I tend to build Essence Reaver in my crit build, and just added 10% Scaling CDR blues (+9 scaling MR) to my runes, so by level 18 or late game (depending on how well I do and in what order I buy Essence Reaver and Infinity Edge) I'll have 40% CDR all of the time. I could opt for 45% as well if I wanted, though the Lethality/Magic Pen. mastery (Precision) might be superior.
-
P.P.S. Usual build before I replace items:
{{item:3006}} {{item:3074}} {{item:3087}}, then either {{item:3031}} or{{item:3508}} first (with 10% scaling CDR blues for 40% CDR late game), then one of these depending on if I want to kill squishies or tanks,
{{item:3036}} {{item:3033}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3078}}. By the time I get my 5th item I've 70% crit.
-
Late game I'll usually replace {{item:3006}} with {{item:3046}}, giving me 100% crit. Then if I don't need the waveclear for split pushing, but think fighting would be the best option, I might replace {{item:3074}} with {{item:3072}} for the extra effective sustain and overheal shield. If I don't care about extra sustain I could just get {{item:2140}} for my lifesteal and replace {{item:3074}} with anything else listed as one of the 6th item options.
-
If I keep a lifesteal item then I've the choice to get {{item:2138}} or {{item:2139}}. With a lot of attack speed (say if I bought Trinity force on top of the crit AS items), {{item:2139}} gives you a constant extra 25 True Damage against towers, which could matter for sieging. Otherwise {{item:2138}} gives you the HP boost you might need along with the Tenacity to survive situations you otherwise might not, while your sustain item keeps you alive long enough to kill important/vulnerable targets. Of course, combining {{item:2140}} WITH a lifesteal item will give you higher sustain (and increases your crits a bit with the added AD from it), assuming you can stick close to your target to get constant autos off (without Tenacity), it depends on the situation. {{item:3078}} + {{item:2138}} would make it very easy to stick to most dashing ADCs, you could combine that with Stormraider's instead of Thunderlord's to be almost impossible to escape from.

I'll end up with something like this if I don't replace anything:
{{item:3006}} {{item:3074}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3508}} {{item:3036}}

Or something like this in the late-late game if I replace items, and if I find the tanks are less relevant (I need to kill squishies at all costs) or there are no tanks:
{{item:3046}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3508}} {{item:3147}} with {{item:2140}} 

Also very good at taking down towers and will kill minions very fast, even without Hydra.

You just won't have any way of replenishing health on minions/jg camps before you start fighting the enemy team, since the lifesteal from {{item:2140}} only works against Champions.
-

Shouldn't crit shaco be rewarded at least a little for backstabbing. Maybe if the backstab was a crit it deals 200% damage and some new interesting effect (like bleed damage or flat damage or extra cdr on q or more interestingly gain an ap ratio or something so really weird hybrid crit builds could be a useful approach too).

Hijacking this for a Fiora question.

If fiora naturally crits with her E-crit bonus will her damage be reduced as well.
Additionally does Backstab get a damage boost from IE? I asumed it did but you're message doesnt include it.

Awesome news :') Thank you! 

Have u considered to return the Backstab dmg to his E?

Some of us really like to have the passive comboing with it and it's also dodgeable from enemies (front face); they are also used to it from before the rework :P

AD Shaco seems very underwhelming now. What is the general consensus with him? I feel like you already nerfed his early game, then you changed the jungle and made it harder for single clearers like Shaco?

> [{quoted}](name=Gone Away,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sTYErWaV,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-11-23T21:05:02.475+0000)
>
> AD Shaco seems very underwhelming now. What is the general consensus with him? I feel like you already nerfed his early game, then you changed the jungle and made it harder for single clearers like Shaco?

We're keeping an eye on the winrate of AD vs AP, currently still in the gathering numbers phase of that exploration. At the moment it looks like AP is a bit stronger than AD, but some of the sample sizes are pretty small and Shaco numbers are themselves a bit weird --- he's a champion overwhelmingly favored by people who've mastered him, he's really sensitive to jungle changes, etc. We'll probably have some balance adjustments for him in the patch after 6.24, but it's hard to say their precise nature until we get clear data.

Right now he just seems so underwhelming if you're not playing him AP. Before with 4 items on AD Shaco you could delete an ADC or one of their damage dealers. Now when he builds AD he seems like he can barely do 50% of their health and now he's in the middle of their team.  Some of the quality of life changes you did really are fun. Like placing boxes while stealth, or allowing him to stealth ult. But it just feels like he has no presence at any point of the game any longer.

What was your intention with your changes? I've always felt that Shaco was strong early game but he fell off late game. Now it seems like he's weak early game. And he does really nothing late game. 

And on one more note.  Is there anyway you can improve his boxes in the jungle? I understand the reason why you didn't want stacking (because lets be real it's kinda cheesy if you walked into a box nest and are insta killed. But now it feels very hard to place his boxes in a optimal position. Can you give some sort of indicator which tells you how far the box can be next to one another?

From what I remember, they wanted to tone down his early game while buffing his late game. 
Also, I think I saw a post from Faux on reddit, where he was explaining that his intention was for us to build Crit. + CDR items. 

We'll see with 6.24 :)
Pretty much Shaco has to build AP now to do what his old AD build did, but now he can't even split push or clear jungle to help him get that.

I'm replying about the mid-patch nerf you did to shaco 

RIP any sort of early game sustain if you try to lane top. Shaco players have such a hard time laning early game as is. Now there is no chance for them. Guess I have to try even harder to make it work. Its literally adrenaline inducing to even keep the max skill cap of shaco up every game (Not Fun!!!). Now that I finally made ap shaco top lane work so well I get punished with this nerf. Please Fix shaco's early game sustain at least. Its literally try to snowball and be useful to team late game or be bad mid and late game all together no matter what the early game outcome is.

as far as i remember Shaco's Boxes (before rework) do not procs Thunderlord at all. For me that seems pretty unfair compared to other champions that can use thunderlord in 1 shot

For instance {{champion:24}} Jax - He jumps on you and instant thunderlord

as far as i remember Thunderlord requires to be stacked BUT
some champion either get no stacks from some spells 
OR 3 stacks on 1 spell
T.Y.
His E does no dmg unless you build AP
Are there any buffs coming his way, specifically to his E? His Ad damage seems so underwhelming.
His E? Shaco E is fine right now, i would go so far as to say it's the best change they made on his spells. If anything his Q, his Boxes and  his buggy Passive need some more loving.
SALVATION THE BITCHING PAID OFF

Thank you Rito for addressing my clown <3.
-----
And if you gave AD some help, I wouldn't hold it against you.

Actually I want to amend that, what they're doing is fixing the fact that at the moment even if you build crit, if the passive procs, you only do the damage of the passive. Now the normal crits will override the passive, making you do full damage. The only time passive crits are important now is when you're not succeeding with normal crits (not getting good rng). Perhaps now if you normal crit, your passive will still be up? If it doesn't go on CD, that would be spiffy when you don't have 100% crit chance. You'd still be a lot more likely to do extra damage from behind when you don't get normal crits off consistently.

I'm with Barful. Backstab needs something else to buff it when it crits. What if a crit backstab reset his deceit so shaco has the opportunity to either finish the job or book it out of there if things don't go well?
